notes: Mixed evidence; possible improvement in stores
Mg regulates Ca transport & balance; deficiency disrupts Ca homeostasis.
Vitamin D increases Mg absorption; mutual activation.
Antioxidant protection may reduce anemia risk.
Vitamin A co-supplementation improves Hb and reduces IDA prevalence.
Zinc supports erythropoiesis and immune-linked anemia improvement.
Slight improvement in ferritin over time with C supplementation.
Mg acts as cofactor for pyridoxal kinase (B6 activation).
High Ca intake can compete with Mg absorption.
Possible decreased TIBC with improved iron utilization from D.
